body.p:
Williamstown Grant County Ky
December 14th 1863
To Hon Thomas. E. Bramlett Governor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky.

Your Petitioners State that at the last October Term of the Grant Circuit Court, that there was a Judgement Rendered agst them for a fine of Twenty Dollars and Costs, for Gameing on the premises of others. They say that they were only playing a small game of Poker for amusement, merely betting enough to keep the game. and did not. and did not suppose they were Violating and did not intend to violate law. They say that they are poor men, and illy able to pay said fine, that they are married men and Fathers of large Families, dependant Solely. upon them for Support= that they meet with one or two of their Neighbors and engaged in the game merely to while away. the tedium of the night. last Spring. therefore as they intended to do no wrong and set no bad example to the Young and are is Really to poor to pay the fine. without Serious, grievance to their Families. They pray Your Honor to Remit. and acquit them from the payment of the same.

We whose names are hereunto Subscribed Joyn in the prayer of Your Petitioners and Say that they are
poor men with large Families, and present fair grounds. for the interposition of Your Clemency on that score. and Respectfully ask, that their fine may be Remitted

Lewis Myers
T. L. Clark
L. A. Franklin C.G.C.C
O P Hogan
N. H. Jeffers clk G.C.C.
J M Collins atto
D L Cunningham J.P.G.C
John Marksbury SGV

Grant County
Refused
T E Bramlette
